title: Keen Dreams 3D:  Production is beginning
content: Just wanted to let you guys know that I'm beginning production on Keen Dreams 3D.  It'll definitely be done before 2004 is over, and you'll have some screenshots to look at in the next few days...

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D:  Production is beginning
content:
Are you serious, that means you're done before Keen 4 3D. I'm really looking foreward to see your stuff.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] -----------------
[url=http://www.geocities.com/theholyrealm/]The Holy Realm[/url]

[url=http://s4.invisionfree.com/The_Dos_Vault_Forum/index.php]The Dos Vault Forum is BACK!!! And it's here to stay.[/url]

title: KD3D
content:
That sounds freakin AWESOME! Believe it or not, Keen Dreams is one of my favorite games in the series[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] (next to Keen 4)--and I'd sorta like to help if there's anything I can do--like level design. But you probably want to do that. So will it be 3rd person or a 3D sidescroller? ------------------
Check out my remixes at... uh... man, I need a site.

title: Re: KD3D
content:
looking forward to it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Visit my website at [url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario]www.geocities.com/superadammario[/url]
or visit my message board at [url=http://pub40.ezboard.com/bsuperadammariosboard]pub40.ezboard.com/bsuperadammariosboard[/url]

title: Re: KD3D
content: You wouldn't happen to be a fellow DarkBasic programmer would you? I just happen to be writing a 3d Keen game in Darkbasic, and frankly, I could use someone to exchange ideas with.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pirate.gif[/img]

title: Re: KD3D
content:
Velkomen to the board. I want to learn DarkBASIC but I don't have the money to buy it (there needs to be a : poor emoticon). I also wanna design 3D models but I don't know which modeling program to get. ------------------
Check out my remixes at... uh... man, I need a site.

title: Re: KD3D
content:
^ I would like all that too.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Well, no skills, no tools and so on.

Anyways, that sounds really cool thenewmoonsidianX! Can't wait for the screens!We want Keen Chronicles!

title: Re: KD3D
content:
About 3D Modelling and programming tools -

I learn Java

3D modelling tools:

- CarCad is not a real 3D modeler but at least it lets you edit the triangles as closely as you can (freeware, if I remember well)

- PhotoModeler Lite turns pictures into 3D models, very cool (freeware)

- MilkShape3D is a program I haven't seen yet so I don't know if it is freeware or not but it appears to be easy to use, because I have seen what can it do - not so freakin' awesome models, but they are recognisable... (I don't know)

Edit: And ehm... Looking forward to KD3D!!![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

title: Keen Dreams 3D:  Production is underway now
content:
Thanks guys!

Just to answer some of your questions, I will be using 3D Game Studio to make this, which is very easy (and fun!) to work with. It'll be third-person, not a sidescroller. As for modeling, I'll welcome anybody who can help me model all of the enemies. But show the stuff here before e-mailing it to me.

My progress so far: The only model I have done right now is Keen in his PJs, and today I'm going to start designing the 3D land of Tuberia. I have a schedule for this game, and I'll probably spend 5-6 days on each level, which means it'll be done in the near future.

As for finishing it before the Keen4 3D team, that's just because I'm a more efficient guy than they are. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D:  Production is underway now
content:
And after this you're going to make a 3d version all right![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] -----------------
[url=http://www.geocities.com/theholyrealm/]The Holy Realm[/url]

[url=http://s4.invisionfree.com/The_Dos_Vault_Forum/index.php]The Dos Vault Forum is BACK!!! And it's here to stay.[/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D:  Production is underway now
content:
I'm not sure whether or not to believe that this will EVER HAPPEN.-----
Before you judge someone, walk a mile in their shoes. You'll be a mile away and have their shoes!

Hey, don't be a pessimist. I believe it'll get done--haven't you seen the 3D model of Keen?------------------
Check out my remixes at... uh... man, I need a site.

title: Re: ..
content:
I don't mean to be pessimistic, but I'm just very used to such things never being finished.

I also don't like Keen Dreams that much. I'm not fond of games that make vital items hidden. I'm sure said complications could be remedied in a 3D recreation, but it's still not my favorite game. All aside, I presume you're recreating the game due to lack of the Pogo Stick implementation?-----
Before you judge someone, walk a mile in their shoes. You'll be a mile away and have their shoes!

title: Re: ..
content: Ohh, the pogo can't be that hard to make.. Probably he just likes Keen Dreams a lot, and IIRC he has planned to do the trilogy (Keen 1-3) also.We want Keen Chronicles!

title: Re: ..
content:
Awesometastic. But how would you recreate a 2D game as a 3D First Person game? If you recreated the levels to be how they are in the original game, the levels would probably seem rather...flat. I just think it would be unneccesary to add another dimension to this kind of platformer.-----
Before you judge someone, walk a mile in their shoes. You'll be a mile away and have their shoes!

title: Re: ..
content:
You can also just create new levels which look like the old ones.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] -----------------
[url=http://www.geocities.com/theholyrealm/]The Holy Realm[/url]

[url=http://s4.invisionfree.com/The_Dos_Vault_Forum/index.php]The Dos Vault Forum is BACK!!! And it's here to stay.[/url]

title: Keen Dreams 3d:  Still underway...
content:
Hey don't worry about it guys. I got Tentacles Ate My Babysitter and Goodbye Monkey Island completed in under three months each, didn't I?

allstories, sorry if you didn't like Keen Dreams. I chose it for my first 3D Keen game because of one reason: it's the easiest to program (lack of pogo stick will ease production a lot). I'm no C-Script wiz, but I know enough to have Keen locked out of the final level until he collects 15 Boobus Bombs! Despite this, play control will be exactly like the original game.

As for the levels, they'll retain their basic structure from the original games, but be much more wide open. For instance, remember that road-walkway thingy Keen walks along in the first level (Horseradish Hill)? In the 3D game, it'll we wide enough for lots of freedom of movement, and yet confined to a path (that's just the same formula as Crash Bandicoot, and it worked, didn't it? The only thing different from CB with this game will be the ability to turn the camera)

However, don't expect this to be the most detailed game in the world. I'm going for a very simple style with solid colors, to try to keep that "cartoon" feel of the original game (it looks alot like Kirby 64, which ironically was also heavily influenced by Crash Bandicoot!)

And finally, I am going to do Keen 1-3 in 3D after this if this is a success (by then I'll be able to program a pogo stick).

[quote]Quote:[hr]You can also just create new levels which look like the old ones. [hr][/quote]

Hmm...you mean like bonus secret levels?

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3d:  Still underway...
content:
If it helps at all, here's my pogo-stick code from DarkBasic:

...
pogo=-1
...
if controlkey()=1 and playergrav#=0
if pogo=1 then playergrav#=3.9 else playergrav#=3.0
endif
if pogo=1 and playergrav#=0 then playergrav#=2.7
if scancode()=56 then pogo=0-pogo
...

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3d:  Still underway...
content:
3rd person? Is that the behind person view? I love that! Nice selection! Keen Dreams 3D, go, go, go!

Hmmm, that pogo code sounds interesting I did some programming in DarkBasic some years ago so I guess I'll copy-paste and have a look at it, if you don't mind (also preserve it to the future)

------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3d:  Still underway...
content: You can have my entire 3d-keen source code (so far) if you want, all 800 lines of it. PM me. (Keep in mind, I'm no artist either.)

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3d:  Still underway...
content:
Tomorrow: 3 screenshots of the overworld Tuberia area (rather barren, because it's not completely finished yet. By barren I mean no castle, Melon Mines, etc. Spatang.com's map of the original 2D Tuberia has helped a lot)

btw, I don't need a pogo code because Keen Dreams has no pogo.

Finally, this may be a HUGE shock, but I expect this project to be done by mid-August. This year.

title: Re: Earthbound!
content:
Hey guys, I'm back. Sorry for the long absence from these forums - I've been really busy lately with school and real-life stuff.

Anyway, Keen Dreams 3D progress is coming along OK. Things are getting finished, slowly but surely. My hard drive stopped working back in January, but luckily, I told the guy at Radio Shack what to save before wiping it out and KD3D got saved. However, I still need somebody to help me out with the C-scripting. I solved the pole problem, but I still need help on instant death collisions and how to make Keen shoot seeds. I'm hoping the game'll be finished soon, but don't keep your fingers crossed, because I still have a lot to do.

Also Djaser, what second project are you referring to? If you mean the continuation of my series where Holiday Hijinx! was the first part, everyone who didn't like the engine will be comforted to know that I'm switching studios, but I don't want to say anything else for now, as I'm still working with it.

title: Re: Earthbound!
content:
Yeah, I was talking about that christmass game-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Earthbound!
content: I'm working on texturing and animating the Milkshape models in 3DGS (I'd post screenshots - but like I said, I've been really busy with other stuff lately), and I was just wondering about the carrots in Keen Dreams (those crazy guys that run around on the first level).  Are they brown in the original game because of the lack of the available colors or am I just mistaking it for another vegetable?  Thanks for any help / insight on this.

title: Re: Earthbound!
content:
They're radishes, I believe.------------------------------------
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Q90]See My Xanga (PLEASE!!!!!!!!)[/url]
[url=http://qsilver90.com][img]http://qsilver90.com/images/logos/logo.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Earthbound!
content:
Hard to say, they could also be red beets or tuber-celery (most likely not the right word). They're to small for radishes which also come in bunches. I think you should use your own imagery here.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Earthbound!
content:
Don't know whether it's official, but according to Spatang, the creature your talking about is a 'Carrot Courier', which would seem to imply that it's a carrot.

I used to think that they were something like red beets or radish (they looked much darker than any carrot I've ever seen, of course, that could be due to limitations, as said earlier...)

title: Re: Earthbound!
content: Well, when I played Keen Dreams when I was little, I just assumed that they were horseradishes because that was the name of the level (Horseradish Hill).  Now older and wiser, I think that they're carrots, and they're only brown due to a lack of available colors.  But if I was making the game in 16 colors, I would've chosen red, but that's just me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: KD3D:  Nearing completion
content:
Okay guys. Keen Dreams 3D is nearing completion. I still have my C-scripting hurdles to jump, and there's still a lot to do, but at least everything is, overall, inching closer and closer to being finished. I'm aiming for a late April/early May release, but don't sue me if it's still not done by then - it's not like I'm working on this thing 24/7! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

In the meantime, here's a ZIP of what I've been up to lately. It contains some images of models and some remixes of music. Let me know what you think. Criticize constructively if you feel like it - I want to make this game as great as possible and please you guys. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] Let me know what you think I should change or fix.

[url=http://www.freewebs.com/keatonsworld/Kd3dnewstuff.zip]www.freewebs.com/keatonsw...wstuff.zip[/url]

(Don't forget to right-click and Save Target As).

title: Re: KD3D:  Nearing completion
content:
Is it just me or is it corrupted?

[img]http://jbrent.no-ip.com/andrew/files/oops.bmp[/img]

I also tried it with win rar and it did the same thing.-----------------------
Save a little money each month and at the end of the year you'll be surprised at how little you have.

title: Re: KD3D:  Nearing completion
content: Yeah, couldn't open it either. :\You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: KD3D:  Nearing completion
content: Download it in IE, then. Non-IE browsers don't like Freewebs.

content:

title: Re: KD3D:  Nearing completion
content:
Well, I tested downloading it and it seemed to work fine. Make sure you right-click the link and choose "Save Target As" on the list that pops up. Freewebs is really picky about downloading stuff outside of one of their websites.

Oh, and if you meant that you downloaded it and it won't open, all I can figure out is to try downloading it again.

content:

content:
Yaay, progress! I've been waiting for this for a loong time...

The new Keen model is far better than the last one. Good work!------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

"Take evasive action!"

title: Classy.
content:
Excellent.

My beefs so far:

- body is too cone-like
- arms are too curvey
- nose is too pointy (should be rounder and more Uish)
- helmet needs more detailed textures and should at least partially cover his ears
- zip needs shininess

That's MKO, anyway.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Much better so far than the previous one, though. *applauds*Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"You are so afraid to live--so afraid of life itself--that you've given up the very nature of your being in trade for security."
-CWG Book 3, Neale Donald Walsh

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

content: Thanks for the advice, I'll start fixing it up. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

-More shininess on the zipper

title: hmm
content: Has the "G" always been that small and high up on the side?  Or was it changed that way, as part of a style update for the team?  (I'm from San Diego, which is Chargers territory, and have seen the style of helmet change here and there)...

title: Re: hmm
content:
This is an old image, taken way before the Keen games were made. (from the team's official website)
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v505/z-one/gbp.jpg[/img]

It seems to me that the G was a bit lower and bigger, but not very different. They never had green G letters on their helmet like in the game.

title: Re: hmm
content:
Yeah Newmoon, a higher detailed model is cool and so on...
But when you try to make it it has to look better overall than the previous version. You really have to let his arms and slippers look more realistic. The details on his helmet should have more gravity or let out.

Just my two cents.

BTW. is Xtraverse still going to upload you other game this century?-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: hmm
content:
Xky: I haven't done any animation yet...I'm trying to get all the kinks worked out of the geometry and so forth before I start animating. Once I do though, I hope to upload some animated GIFs (I'm so relieved to get rid of Freewebs[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )

What do you guys recommend I should do for the helmet so that it covers his ears, because I'm kind of stumped. Could it be done with just a sphere? What I've been doing is highlighting the bottom-left quarter of a sphere from a right-side view and deleting the highlighted part, and passing it off as the helmet. I suppose I could use multiple spheres, but I don't know how that would look.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]

Djaser: You mean the Christmas game? Not sure. He said that he got it, though. He could always wait until next Christmas to upload...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-christmas.gif[/img]

Thanks for all the advice, everyone! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: yes
content: Alright, if you're gonna do it with a flat sphere, here's how I'd do it.  Put the sphere in mid-air, grab a plain, ordinary cube, mash that in the place where Keen's head is going to go--it should stick out on the front and bottom, but not on the sides.  Now carve that sphere.  Look at the picture of Keen running from Robo Red up above *points* ... see?  :-)

title: Re: yes
content:
Or just look at the photo up there for some minutes, open your 3D editor, and try to get it copied.------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

"Take evasive action!"

title: Re: yes
content: Sorry for my absence lately.  I've been really pressed down with school (one of the reasons why this is taking so long[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] ) but I think I've fixed the helmet.  I'll upload a picture later today.

content: [url=http://www.imageshack.us][img]http://img125.echo.cx/img125/9876/keen3dhelmet8zm.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: yes
content:
Far better - now on to the chest - try to push some vertices up, so you'd get some more shoulders. Than you could make the arms go more down, like in case of a photo, not to the side, than down.------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

"Take evasive action!"

title: Re: yes
content:
The eyes are uneven, which looks quite strange - maybe make the pupil/iris a bit bigger too? (matter of personal opinion, that one...)

The arms look awkward because he has no neck, and no clear shoulders as a result. Maybe they should be a bit higher up, at least?[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Nifty.
content:
The brighter sky is my preference... but I suggest making it parallax. I presume the final game is going to have a horizon of some sort? The sky texture splattered all over the walls and floor really doesn't look right.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"You are so afraid to live--so afraid of life itself--that you've given up the very nature of your being in trade for security."
-CWG Book 3, Neale Donald Walsh

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Nifty.
content: The brighter shots looks more like super mario. But Keen Dreams look like it too, although it was a nightmare, so my vote goes for the brighter version. It looks more keenish to me.----

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
I'd vote for something in-between. A little light is needed but not as much as the bright version has, 'cos it'd completely destoy the shadows. Even though the original Dreams had only 16 colors and for the levels they used even less, that doesn't mean you have to make your game look like EGA too. The dark sky does look more nightmareish but it's color should be less purple and more blue, and there are too many cloud's edges visible which makes it a bit weird. Maybe that's why others don't like it? The light one is good too, but it needs more tones.

Even if you change nothing, this is a promising project and I'm looking forward to what you make out of it. I'm a bit curious about what the gameplay will be like?

title: gah
content: I'm such a 3d-a-phobe... recognizing where the seams on the skybox were gave me shivers.  :-(

title: Re:
content: The bright sky looks abyssmal. The darker one is a lot better. Though aren't you able to make the background something other than a texture? It looks terrible when it's all warped like that.

title: Re: Re:
content:
It should be a little brighter than the dark version, but the bright one is waay too bright. And one thing - try some textures at www.3dcafe.com please - they are free and I believe it would make those wooden platforms better.------------------------------------------------------
Keep in mind, I'm not an artist.

"Take evasive action!"

title: I'm back!
content:
Hi guys! I'm really sincerely sorry for my insanely extended absence...I really just haven't had time to get on these forums, what with school and other projects to work on.

Anyways, I'd just like to report that Keen Dreams 3D is finally 100% officially finished! It's all done at last, but the issue now is how on earth I'm going to get an 80 MB collection of files onto the web with dial-up. Any ideas?

title: Re: I'm back!
content:
SQUEEEE [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I'd say the best way would be to burn it onto CD-R and send it to someone. Not only would it be faster, it'd be cheaper too (even if you had to buy a CD burner [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ).[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

content:
Wow, 80 megs is incredible!
Hey, I have plenty of webspace with unlimited bandwidth usage and a fast net connection to upload from. I'd be happy to host it for you. Send me an ezboard message or email me (zach [at] keenx.com) with a way to tell you my snail mail address without posting it on the board.

title: Re: In-slain...
content:
Cool your back Moon. Great to hear Keens dreams 3d is finished. How is the sam and max fan game going so far? Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]

title: Re: In-slain...
content:
Okay, I've sent the game on a CD to Vitamin Zach. I've also started another thread that you guys can move discussion to in the Releases forum.

Xtraverse, thanks for the offer to let me upload it, but with the experience I've had when trying to upload things on SmartFTP with my dial-up, it rarely gets all the way through with large files...and the game'll get to you guys faster this way. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Superaddammario64: The Sam & Max fangame is going great. We've even got our own public website going now: [url=http://www.flintlocked.com]www.flintlocked.com[/url]

title: Re: In-slain...
content:
use File Lodge. Its Free and you can upload 500mb worth and it will give you a direct link and will never expire.

[url=http://www.filelodge.com/]FileLodge[/url]

Only thing is, your files must be 50mb or less each, so youll have to have them split in parts using winzip (which i would do anyway if your on dial-up)

title: Re: In-slain...
